tweet: Tomorrow is #SmallBusinessSaturday! We're lucky to have many excellent small businesses throughout the 8th district. I hope you'll join me in shopping small tomorrow.  http://www.sba.gov/saturday  pic.twitter.com/LHmW2PtQlb

Let the Thanksgiving prep and cooking begin! As a doctor, I would be remiss not to highlight food safety information ahead of the holiday. Thanks to the @USDAFoodSafety for the tips. https://twitter.com/USDAFoodSafety/status/1197156018859495424 …

SNAP and the school meals program measurably reduce the rate of poverty. It is unfair and cruel for the department to move forward with a rule that will clearly reduce access to nutrition programs that have been show to reduce poverty. #1MillionKids are relying on us.

The @USDA proposed rule will increase the number of hungry children instead of lowering it. In WA08, there are over 3,300 students who are at risk for losing free school meals. Many of these students eat two meals at school & these are often the only nutritious meals they get.

Yesterday I held my 24th Town Hall (on the 24th!) Thank you to everyone who has attended one so far. The questions & concerns expressed at town halls have helped shape my policy decisions in DC and make me a better advocate for the 8th district. I look forward to many more soon! pic.twitter.com/XYB2BxVIbr

Happy to join Washington members on both sides of the aisle to introduce a resolution in honor of the Sounders' championship win! Proud of their efforts on and off the field. https://www.king5.com/article/sports/soccer/sounders-fc/washington-lawmakers-honor-sounders-fc/281-73db947c-5078-4974-9418-77e9b6c9abf9 …
We need solutions to expand access to healthcare, strengthen rural workforce retention, and utilize broadband and other tele-health technologies to ensure patients receive adequate and quality care.

Today is #NationalRuralHealthDay! Patients and their families in rural communities often have to travel long distances to see providers and receive the services they need. https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/rural-hospital-closings-cause-mortality-rates-rise-study-finds-n1048046 …
These caregivers are often helping us and our families on our worst days, so the least we can do is to make sure they are safe.

I was proud to vote for this bill today that will create stronger protections for health care & social service workers, who have a higher rate of workplace violence in their jobs. https://twitter.com/EdLaborCmte/status/1197571478918750208 …

I really enjoyed meeting with the young activists of @EffectMigration , especially on #WorldChildrensDay! They have already made over 41, 000 butterflies to represent children who have migrated to the U.S. but are in detention centers. Sam & I will make making our own next week. pic.twitter.com/bfGIc8qmBe

Last week I joined @OversightDems hearing to talk about the unnecessary restrictions states are putting on health providers. But as a doctor, I couldn't let one of the witness's comments that were pseudoscience and baloney go without responding to them. pic.twitter.com/GnuLbhzAUM
I will be holding my next Town Hall in Issaquah on Sunday at 3pm. Hope to see you there!… https://schrierissaquahtownhall2019.eventbrite.com

I enjoyed hearing from firefighters in Leavenworth last weekend about the town’s high risk for wildfire, and what local stakeholders are doing to make Leavenworth more resilient. Chelan County Fire District #3 and the Chumstick Wildfire Stewardship Coalition are leading the way. pic.twitter.com/5Z17CVTW7s

It's #NationalRecyclingDay! I spoke on the House floor today about recycling, but also how important the 2 other "Rs" are: reduce & reuse. Bring your own spork! Use a reusable bottle or coffee mug! In DC, I will be working to reduce the plastic footprint of the U.S. House. pic.twitter.com/kJAZWTi2Ma

Today is #WorldDiabetesDay and November is National Diabetes Awareness Month. As one of 2 members of Congress with Type 1 Diabetes, I’m proud to make #T1D, an invisible disease, a little more visible. #TheDropSpotted pic.twitter.com/Ki7c8qcz24

Proud to vote for this bill to specifically help women veterans by expanding medical services at the VA for women and establishing policies to report & respond to harassment at VA facilities. Women veterans have given so much to our country and their care should honor that. https://twitter.com/RepMarkTakano/status/1192896025968726021 …
Thank you for having me for this important discussion! https://twitter.com/NWHarvest/status/1194388454706163712 …

Back in the district, my office has helped veterans who are struggling to access the benefits they deserve, whether that’s health care, a loan for a house, or getting a degree. Freedom is not free and I am committed to making sure we honor veterans for their service every day.

Thank you to the the 50,000 veterans in the 8th District and many thousands more in WA state. In the House, I voted for the Blue Water Navy Vietnam Veterans Act and have joined the growing efforts to prevent veterans suicide. pic.twitter.com/9tbotmLNmk
Congrats @SoundersFC! #SoundersMatchday https://twitter.com/MLS/status/1193653854228729858 …

I even had the opportunity to try their new Fit milk, which contains 25 grams of protein, 40% less sugar, and is lactose free. A huge thank you to Stan and all of the Darigold employees for hosting me and for all of your work!

Had a great time at an employee town hall at Darigold. They asked me thoughtful questions about the House's work on reducing healthcare costs, student loan forgiveness plans, agriculture sustainability practices, and much more. pic.twitter.com/Ux7gxe26Wp
Thanks for participating and giving me input on how I can best advocate for students in WA! https://twitter.com/icw/status/1192204306721599488 …

I really enjoyed my recent hike with veterans who work at @REI. We talked about the therapeutic value of spending time outdoors, and what it is like for today’s military veterans transitioning back into civilian life. pic.twitter.com/tJObSh3i2G

Thank you for having me and congratulations to Mr. Pederson on earning such a prestigious award! Your students, Eatonville, and the 8th District are lucky to have you. https://twitter.com/EatonvilleSD/status/1191850133782061057 …

This Saturday I will be holding a pinning ceremony for Vietnam-era veterans who have given so much to our country, and deserve recognition. Are you a Vietnam-era veteran but can't make it on Saturday? We owe it to our children and future generations we will never know to take action now. I will continue to work on the urgent issue of climate change and towards a sustainable future.

We are facing a climate crisis. This move by the Administration is short-sighted and irresponsible. The House saw this coming. I am proud to have voted for the Climate Action Now Act (HR9) earlier this year that would keep the U.S. in the Paris Agreement. https://twitter.com/NPR/status/1191457545132691462 …

This is such great news! The Snoqualmie Tribe will again own an integral and magnificent part of their ancestral land and I join them in celebration. I would like to recognize both the Snoqualmie and Muckleshoot Tribes for finalizing this historic agreement. https://twitter.com/seattletimes/status/1190348108842049536 …

Open enrollment for health insurance begins today and runs through December 15th. It's time to #GetCoveredWA, whether you are signing up for a plan or renewing your current one. More info here:  http://wahealthplanfinder.org  https://twitter.com/WAplanfinder/status/1190303424304205824 …
